meanings.definition: To treat or combine with fluorine.
meanings.sent1: The scientists will fluorinate the water to make it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: It is important to fluorinate the toothpaste to prevent cavities.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally fluorinated the wrong chemical, and now it's glowing!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to fluorinate the room with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The firefighters used a special spray to fluorinate the flames and put out the fire.

meanings.definition: To undergo a reaction with fluorine.
meanings.sent1: The metal will fluorinate when exposed to the strong acid.
meanings.sent2: Certain plastics can fluorinate when exposed to extreme heat.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter seemed to fluorinate as soon as it touched the hot oven.
meanings.sent4: His ideas began to fluorinate in his mind, sparking new innovations.
meanings.sent5: The fabric started to fluorinate under the intense UV light.

meanings.definition: To introduce fluorine into a compound.
meanings.sent1: The chemist will fluorinate the organic molecule to enhance its properties.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to fluorinate certain medications for better efficacy.
meanings.sent3: The potion recipe called for a pinch of powdered unicorn horn to fluorinate the mixture.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm seemed to fluorinate the entire team, boosting morale.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special technique to fluorinate the colors in the painting, making them pop.
